page.title: 18Arts in Hebden Bridge
page.content: For a small provincial town Hebden Bridge has a lively artistic life. After the demise of the manufacturing industries in the 1970s many artists and craftspeople moved into open workshops, studios and small potteries, many of which are in private houses and converted mills. The{Arvon Foundation}was created by the poet Ted Hughes to encourage young writers; it is situated on farmland above Heptonstall. Writers from all over the world attend the workshop sessions held there. Local groups like the {Literary and {Scientific Society}meet regularly. The Hebden Bridge{Light Opera Society}put on musicals two or three times a year and the local dramatic society presents plays regularly in a small theatre in Holme Street. The latter is a converted garage.
